intro: Cyrtandra ootensis, commonly known as the Ootacamund cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking tubular flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often trailing. Cyrtandra ootensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
